lead_paragraph: The slickly-produced videos, broadcast on Iranian state television, include suspects confessing to crimes that happened after they had been incarcerated.

byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.

headline.print_headline: Rights Groups Assail Iran Over Videos of Prisoners Before Hanging
headline.main: Rights Groups Assail Iran Over Videos of Condemned Prisoners

snippet: The slickly-produced videos, broadcast on Iranian state television, include suspects confessing to crimes that happened after they had been incarcerated....
abstract: Amnesty International accuses Iranian government of using coerced confessions to justify mass hangings of Sunni prisoners; charges further that government is running propaganda videos of the confessions on state-backed media outlets in order to exacerbate fears about Islamic State group among majority Shiite population.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
